block.p: Elizabeth Anne Senior and Charles Evans Hayward were married yesterday at Inn by the Sea in Cape Elizabeth, Me. Ron Ward, a justice of the peace in Portland, Me., officiated.

The bride, who is 41 and is keeping her name, is a co-owner of the Senior & Shopmaker Gallery in New York, which specializes in modern and contemporary American and European art. Until last year she owned a gallery in SoHo that bore her name. She graduated from Stanford University, and is a daughter of Dorothy Lowe of Seven Mile Beach, Grand Cayman, and the late John L. Senior Jr., who lived in Southbury, Conn. The bride's previous marriage ended in divorce.

Until last year she owned a gallery in SoHo that bore her name. She graduated from Stanford University, and is a daughter of Dorothy Lowe of Seven Mile Beach, Grand Cayman, and the late John L. Senior Jr., who lived in Southbury, Conn. The bride's previous marriage ended in divorce.

The bridegroom, 49, is the president and chief operating officer of The Daily Racing Form, a newspaper on thoroughbred racing in New York. He is a former president of Little, Brown & Company and of the adult hardback book division at Simon & Schuster, the publishers. He graduated from Bowdoin College. He is the son of Pamelia Hayward of Bridgton, Me., and the late H. John Hayward.
